questions.text: During the process of photosynthesis, which takes place primarily in the chloroplasts of plant cells, light energy is converted into chemical energy that is stored in glucose molecules — but which specific pigment, found in the thylakoid membranes, is primarily responsible for absorbing the light energy that drives this complex multi-step biochemical process?
options: Chlorophyll, the primary green pigment found in the thylakoid membranes of chloroplasts that absorbs light energy
Carotenoid pigments found in root cells
Melanin, the pigment responsible for skin color
Hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying molecule in blood
